titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Daniel Schwarz DC poetry oral history collection, 2012 MS2320

repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

did.unittitle: Daniel Schwarz DC poetry oral history collection
did.physloc: Materials are stored off-site, and will require additional retrieval time. Please contact the Special Collections Research Center for more information.
did.abstract: This collection contains oral histories (recordings and transcripts) with local poets E. Ethelbert Miller, Kim Roberts, and Sarah Browning. Daniel Schwarz conducted these interviews as part of a course assignment while he was a student at American University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please cite unpublished materials in the following way:
Please provide the title and date of item, catalog number (if applicable it will be found written on the folder), name of the collection, name of the repository, and location of the repository.

Example: James Oglethorpe to the Trustees, 13 January 1876, RG0001 Series 1, Box 4, Folder 3. Records of the Board of Trustees, Special Collections Research Center, Gelman Library, The George Washington University, Washington, D.C.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Daniel Schwarz was a graduate of the Public History MA Program at American University. During his time at American, Schwarz focused his studies on modern American cultural history, and examined the ways in which literature has reflected the ideologies of Americans and simultaneously shaped American society. Prior to joining the program, Schwarz received a BA in English from Skidmore College in 2006. At Skidmore, he studied creative writing with poet Carolyn Forch√©, novelist Steven Millhauser, and playwright Stephanie Fleischmann. He received his Master's Degree in August 2013.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains oral histories with E. Ethelbert Miller, Kim Roberts, and Sarah Browning. The folders include the recording on CD and a printed transcript as well as a short biographical sheet. These oral histories were conducted between October - November 2012.

As a student in Professor Daniel Kerr's Oral History class at American University, Daniel Schwarz decided to interview three poets who have made significant contributions to the DC-area poetry scene: Sarah Browning, E. Ethelbert Miller, and Kim Roberts. Over the course of these interviews, the poets describe the ways in which they have witnessed the local poetry scene evolve over time. They also examine the aspects of the DC-area poetry scene that distinguish it from other literary communities. Browning, Miller, and Roberts discuss the circumstances in their lives that motivated them to become poets, and share their opinions about the present state of poetry in DC and the nation, as well as the future of the medium.
